content.body: we really need to do something about the `NewTarget` special form
content.formatted_body: we really need to do something about the NewTarget special form

content.body: I just want to get rid of it entirely and use `GetNewTarget()` and `lexicalEnvironmentRecord.[[NewTarget]]`
content.formatted_body: I just want to get rid of it entirely and use GetNewTarget() and lexicalEnvironmentRecord.[[NewTarget]]

content.body: it's no worse than "the this value"
there's no need for the special form though
we just use hand-wavey prose to set the `[[NewTarget]]` slot, and it makes it sound like they're two distinct concepts
content.formatted_body: we just use hand-wavey prose to set the [[NewTarget]] slot, and it makes it sound like they're two distinct concepts

content.body: I feel like it's at least somewhat reasonable to write the "I am using new.target in a builtin" and "I am defining the semantics of new.target" forms in a different way

> When invoked with [[Construct]], the this value is uninitialized, the [[Construct]] argumentsList provides the named parameters, and the [[Construct]] newTarget parameter provides the NewTarget value.
content.formatted_body: When invoked with [[Construct]], the this value is uninitialized, the [[Construct]] argumentsList provides the named parameters, and the [[Construct]] newTarget parameter provides the NewTarget value.

content.body: you can't tell me that that's a good way to say `Set lexicalEnvironmentRecord.[[NewTarget]] to _newTarget_`
content.formatted_body: you can't tell me that that's a good way to say Set lexicalEnvironmentRecord.[[NewTarget]] to _newTarget_

content.body: > The this value is uninitialized, argumentsList provides the named parameters, and newTarget provides the NewTarget value.
